p: However, in China, studies on the role of social capital on wellbeing are limited, particularly in the context of acute infectious disease. Therefore, this study aimed to investigate the effects of social capital on sleep quality and the mechanisms involved in people who self-isolated at home for 14 days in January 2020, during the COVID-19 epidemic in central China. In this study, path analysis was performed to evaluate the relationships between a dependent variable (social capital) and two or more independent variables (anxiety, stress, and sleep), using Pearsonâ€™s correlation analysis and structural equation modeling (SEM).
